metadata.name: PowerShell WMI Win32_Product Install MSI
metadata.comment: Detects the execution of an MSI file using PowerShell and the WMI Win32_Product class

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM script_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('invoke-cimmethod ')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('-classname ')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('win32_product ')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('-methodname ')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('.msi')))

output.summary: Detects the execution of an MSI file using PowerShell and the WMI Win32_Product class
